medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ana's symptoms of self-doubt began at age 7, evolving into chronic checking rituals by age 18. Her OCD worsened post-marriage, leading to significant restrictions on her daily activities, including food preparation. Symptoms included compulsive hand washing and obsessive checking of ritual cleanliness. She lost 25 lb over 1 year due to fears surrounding food contamination. Following marriage, her OCD symptoms intensified, leading to increased depression and feelings of guilt.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ana has a history of OCD and major depression. Previously treated with fluoxetine, clomipramine, and sertraline with partial relief. No other relevant past medical history provided.
medical_history.family_history: Anaâ€™s mother has a history of depression and was treated with clomipramine. Her sister underwent psychotherapy without a formal diagnosis. Both parents were described as perfectionists.
medical_history.social_history: Ana is an Orthodox Jewish woman, married, and employed as a sales representative. She has never abused alcohol or illicit drugs. She planned for multiple pregnancies and actively sought treatment to manage her OCD and depression for health and family planning reasons.
